branch.content: Is [] present at different times (the whole object (not only some of its parts), or is it occurring in time?
branch.fork: Persist in time; e.g., a ball
Occurs in time; e.g., kicking

branch.content: Can [] exist on its own or is [] a property of another entity or depends on at least 1 other entity (a bearer)?
branch.fork: Exist on its own; e.g., a sandwich
Dependent on another; e.g., the scent of a perfume

branch.content: Does [] always have some matter (space and mass) as a part that persists in time?
branch.fork: Never; e.g., a cavity in a tooth
Always; e.g., a coffee mug

branch.content: Is [] bounded, partially or wholly, by a material entity or is it a portion in space?
branch.fork: Bounded; e.g., the cavity of a tooth
A portion; e.g., a point in space

branch.content: How many dimensions does [] have?
branch.fork: 3; e.g., the cavity of a tooth

branch.content: How many dimensions does [] have?
branch.fork: 0; e.g., the point where Egypt, Libya, and Sudan meets is a 0D continuant fiat boundary
1; e.g., the border between Namibia and Zimbabwe is a 1D continuant fiat boundary
2; e.g., the side of a cube, the surface of a sweater are 2D continuant fiat boundaries

branch.content: Is the [] a spatial projection of a portion of space-time?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., the space occupied by a bed

branch.content: How many dimensions does [] have?
branch.fork: 0; e.g., a point in space
1; e.g., an edge of a cubed space portion in space
2; e.g., the surface of a sphere-shaped part of space
3; e.g., a sphere-shaped region of space

branch.content: Is [] a collection of disjoint self-standing single objects?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., pack of lions, a collection of marbles
No

branch.content: Is [] a proper part of an object, rather than a member of?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., the upper portion of a cake
No; e.g., a plate

branch.content: May [] be shared/copied between a number of bearers?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., mp4 video file of Star Trek on the computer (bearer)
No; e.g., the role of a reader that cannot be shared among humans (bearer)

branch.content: Does [] require some further process to be realised?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., the researcher has to do research
No; e.g., the colour of the berry

branch.content: Does [] exist because the bearer is in a specific situation?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., a professor
No; e.g., a person has a disposition to anemia

branch.content: Does [] exist (by evolution or design) to realise specific processes?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., writing function: the function of a pen to write

branch.content: Does [] require at least 2 bearers to exist?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., the family history where the 2 bearers are the patient and the family

branch.content: What is []'s relation to the universal spatiotemporal region?
branch.fork: That what happens during that time (inhabits); e.g., the process of stirring a drink
[] is a portion of space and time (portion of); e.g., the spatiotemporal region occupied by a pet
[] is a part of time (projection of); e.g., the hours of rolling blackouts

branch.content: Is [] the boundary of what is occurring?
branch.fork: Yes; e.g., the first or last step of a Kizomba dancing session
No; e.g., the process of dancing during a Kizomba dancing session

branch.content: Does [] describe a process whereby there has been a substantial change?
branch.fork: Yes

branch.content: Does [] describe the rate of change or the actual changes that are occurring?
branch.fork: Change; e.g., urbanisation
Rate of change; e.g., rate of urbanisation in South Africa

branch.content: Is [] a moment or does it take longer?
branch.fork: A moment; e.g., the moment the electricity switches off
Longer; e.g., the duration of a Kizomba dancing session
